Exercise 2.3-6

Exercise 2.3-7

Problem 2-1

Describe a -time algorithm that, given a set of integers and another integer , determines whether or not there exist two elements in whose sum is exactly .

Firstly we sort by way of MERGE-SORT which takes time. We then iterate over our sorted array and use BINARY-SEARCH to determine if the integer that would sum to . BINARY-SEARCH takes time and doing it times takes time. Since both these steps take time, combining the two of them is the same as multiplying that time by a constant factor. Therefore this algorithm runs at time.
